snippet: Reports and relatives spoke of a passenger who lost his passport but found it in time to make the flight and of a young man who was flying home after his mother’s death.
abstract: Relatives grieve passengers presumed dead after EgyptAir flight crashed into Mediterranean Sea; passengers included 30 Egyptians, 15 French citizens and others from wide range of countries.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and NOUR YOUSSEF
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky reported from London, and Nour Youssef from Cairo. Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Daniel Victor from New York.

lead_paragraph: Reports and relatives spoke of a passenger who lost his passport but found it in time to make the flight and of a young man who was flying home after his mother’s death.

headline.main: Despair, Anger and Scant Hope for Relatives of EgyptAir Passengers
headline.print_headline: For Relatives, Despair at Cruel Twists of Fate
